title: Links within SVGs
body:
Clicking `<a>` within SVGs cause issues, in my case missing `<rect>`s. 
On initial load you ought to see 5 boxes(light brown, red, blue, brown and orange).
1. Click 1. Now its 3 boxes (blue, brown and orange).
2. Click 2. Now its 2 boxes (light brown and red).
3. Again click on 1. 2 boxes :worried: (blue and brown)

Where does the orange box disappear to??? :confused: Please note this entire thing is SVG and that the link is actually present in the DOM. It just decided not to show itself.

On Firefox, clicking the link, `TypeError: setting a property that has only a getter` is thrown from  react.js:2059:10 version `0.13.2`.

I initially thought it was a [react-router](https://github.com/rackt/react-router) specific issue. 
[Issue w/ React-router](https://jsfiddle.net/LLv2tfm3/)

Wrong!!! The same issue exists without the library.
[Issue w/o React-router](https://jsfiddle.net/69z2wepo/7889/)

But it doesn't when using a normal SVG element.
[No issue w/o React](https://jsfiddle.net/25jt11qm/1/)

> SVG elements
> The following SVG elements are supported:
> circle defs ellipse g line linearGradient mask path pattern polygon polyline
> radialGradient rect stop svg text tspan

[Source](https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/tags-and-attributes.html)

Although if React doesn't support `<a>` within SVGs it ought to throw an error or something.

Whats the cause of this issue? I'm guessing going with `onClick` would be the viable option right now.
